p. t. barnum.gloss: United States showman who popularized the circus (1810-1891)

pt boat.gloss: a small fast unarmored and lightly armed torpedo boat

pteretis.gloss: small genus sometimes included in genus Onoclea

pteretis struthiopteris.gloss: tall fern of northern temperate regions having graceful arched fronds and sporophylls resembling ostrich plumes

pteridaceae.gloss: one of a number of families into which the family Polypodiaceae has been subdivided in some classification systems

pteridium.gloss: a genus of ferns belonging to the family Dennstaedtiaceae

pteridium aquilinum.gloss: large coarse fern often several feet high

pteridophyta.gloss: containing all the vascular plants that do not bear seeds: ferns, horsetails, club mosses, and whisk ferns

pteridophyte.gloss: plants having vascular tissue and reproducing by spores

pteridosperm.gloss: an extinct seed-producing fernlike plant of the order Cycadofilicales (or group Pteridospermae)

pteridospermae.gloss: used in some classification systems: a group of extinct fossil gymnosperms coextensive with the order Cycadofilicales

pteridospermaphyta.gloss: used in some classification systems: a group of extinct fossil gymnosperms coextensive with the order Cycadofilicales

pteridospermopsida.gloss: extinct gymnosperms most of Carboniferous to Jurassic: seed ferns and allies

pteris.gloss: large genus of terrestrial ferns of tropics and subtropics

pteris serrulata.gloss: fern of North Africa and Azores and Canary Islands

pternohyla fodiens.gloss: terrestrial burrowing nocturnal frog of grassy terrain and scrub forests having very hard upper surface of head

pterocarpus.gloss: genus of tropical trees or climbers having usually broadly winged pods

pterocarpus angolensis.gloss: deciduous South African tree having large odd-pinnate leaves and profuse fragrant orange-yellow flowers

pterocarpus indicus.gloss: tree native to southeastern Asia having reddish wood with a mottled or striped black grain

pterocarpus macrocarpus.gloss: tree of India and Burma yielding a wood resembling mahogany

pterocarpus marsupium.gloss: East Indian tree yielding a resin or extract often used medicinally and in e.g. tanning

pterocarpus santalinus.gloss: tree of India and East Indies yielding a hard fragrant timber prized for cabinetwork and dark red heartwood used as a dyewood

pterocarya fraxinifolia.gloss: medium-sized Caucasian much-branched tree distinguished from other walnut trees by its winged fruit

pterocles alchata.gloss: sandgrouse of Europe and Africa having elongated middle tail feathers

pterocnemia.gloss: a genus of birds of the family Rheidae

pterocnemia pennata.gloss: smaller of two tall fast-running flightless birds similar to ostriches but three-toed

pterodactylidae.gloss: a reptile family in the order Pterosauria

pteropogon.gloss: southern Australian plant having feathery hairs surrounding the fruit

pteropogon humboltianum.gloss: southern Australian plant having feathery hairs surrounding the fruit

pteropsida.gloss: used in former classifications to include all ferns and flowering plants and divided into the three classes Filicinae and Gymnospermae and Angiospermae

pterosaur.gloss: an extinct reptile of the Jurassic and Cretaceous having a bird-like beak and membranous wings supported by the very long fourth digit of each forelimb

pterospermum.gloss: genus of tropical Asian trees and shrubs

pterospermum acerifolium.gloss: Indian tree having fragrant nocturnal white flowers and yielding a reddish wood used for planking

pterostylis.gloss: genus of terrestrial orchids of Australia and New Zealand and western Pacific

pteroylglutamic acid.gloss: a B vitamin that is essential for cell growth and reproduction

pteroylmonoglutamic acid.gloss: a B vitamin that is essential for cell growth and reproduction

ptloris paradisea.gloss: velvety black Australian bird of paradise with green and purple iridescence on head and tail

pto.gloss: a device that transfers power from an engine (as in a tractor or other motor vehicle) to another piece of equipment (as to a pump or jackhammer)

ptolemaic dynasty.gloss: an ancient dynasty of Macedonian kings who ruled Egypt from 323 BC to 30 BC

ptolemy.gloss: Alexandrian astronomer (of the 2nd century) who proposed a geocentric system of astronomy that was undisputed until the late Renaissance
an ancient dynasty of Macedonian kings who ruled Egypt from 323 BC to 30 BC

ptomain.gloss: any of various amines (such as putrescine or cadaverine) formed by the action of putrefactive bacteria

ptomaine.gloss: any of various amines (such as putrescine or cadaverine) formed by the action of putrefactive bacteria
a term for food poisoning that is no longer in scientific use

ptomaine poisoning.gloss: a term for food poisoning that is no longer in scientific use

ptsd.gloss: an anxiety disorder associated with serious traumatic events and characterized by such symptoms as survivor guilt, reliving the trauma in dreams, numbness and lack of involvement with reality, or recurrent thoughts and images

ptyas mucosus.gloss: enter buildings in pursuit of prey

ptychozoon homalocephalum.gloss: a gecko that has membranous expansions along the sides of its body and limbs and tail that enable it to glide short distances

ptyalise.gloss: expel or eject (saliva or phlegm or sputum) from the mouth

ptyalize.gloss: expel or eject (saliva or phlegm or sputum) from the mouth
